output_list.reason: Integer overflow in mintToken function allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The freezeAccount function allows the owner to set the freeze status of an arbitrary user, which can be used to create role-based access controls.
The setPrices function is public and allows any user to set the prices. This can be abused by unauthorized users to set arbitrary prices.
Integer overflow in buy function allows user to set the balance of the contract to zero, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
Integer overflow in sell function allows user to set the balance of the contract to zero, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The selfdestructs function is public and allows any user to set the contract to zero, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The getEth function is public and allows unauthorized users to retrieve arbitrary amounts of eth.
